caption.title: Early forecasts regarding four indicators of operational interest: (A) final epidemic size (total observed cases); (B) maximal weekly observed incidence; (C) date of peak incidence (difference with the date observed thereafter, in months); and (D) duration of the period of high epidemic activity (from date “ S” to date “ E”, in months).
caption.p: The dashed lines represent the values observed after the end of the epidemic. Colours correspond to different a priori distributions on the parameters: non-informative priors or informative priors based on historical data, either considered at the regional or the local level.
